function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Uncertainty in viral titer estimates from wastewater could lead to inaccurate calculations of disease prevalence.","Impact":"Inaccurate disease prevalence estimates could lead to inadequate public health measures and interventions.","Mitigation":"Increased testing of individual stool specimens and improvements in testing algorithms to accurately estimate viral titer per positive stool.","Technologies":"Improved testing algorithms, wastewater surveillance technologies.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, wastewater management personnel.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions."},{"Description":"Limitations in testing capacity and criteria for testing could lead to an underestimate of clinically confirmed cases.","Impact":"Underestimating clinically confirmed cases may result in a lack of appropriate control measures and containment efforts.","Mitigation":"Expansion of testing capacity, relaxation of stringent criteria, and implementation of wastewater-based surveillance for anonymous, unbiased samples.","Technologies":"Wastewater-based surveillance technologies, testing capacity expansion technologies.","People":"Public health officials, healthcare providers, policymakers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, government authorities."},{"Description":"A significant fraction of cases may go undetected with current testing algorithms, especially asymptomatic individuals.","Impact":"The undetected cases may contribute to disease spread and hinder efforts to control the pandemic.","Mitigation":"Improvements in testing algorithms to detect asymptomatic cases and expanded use of wastewater-based surveillance.","Technologies":"Improved testing algorithms, wastewater surveillance technologies.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, healthcare providers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions."}]}
